ai.summary: Caddam Wood is a gentle 4.4 km hike in the UK, classified as easy and suitable for families and beginners. The route takes you through woodland with shaded, well-marked paths and gentle terrain.
ai.terrain_summary: The trail runs primarily through woodlands with a mix of flat to gently rolling sections. Expect well-defined paths, occasional roots or small logs, and potential muddy patches after rain. Footing is generally even, but some sections may be uneven.
ai.safety_notes: Conditions in UK woodlands can change quickly. Check local weather, wear sturdy walking shoes, and stay on marked trails. Bring a waterproof layer, sufficient water, and a small first aid kit. Be mindful of mud after rain, and watch for low-hanging branches or roots. Do not disturb wildlife or vegetation; inform someone of your route and expected return time.
recommended_gear: Light rain jacket or waterproof layer
Map or GPS device / fully charged phone
ai.best_seasons: All year, with the best conditions in late spring to early autumn (roughly March to October) when the trails are drier.

seo.title: Caddam Wood Hike – Easy 4.4 km Woodland Trail in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover Caddam Wood, an easy 4.4 km hike in the UK. Family-friendly woodland trail with shaded paths, practical safety tips, and gear suggestions.
